headline: BHP to Sell Stake in Western Australia Power Infrastructure to BlackRock in $2 Billion Deal
summary: BHP Group will sell a 49% stake in its Western Australia iron-ore power network to BlackRock’s Global Infrastructure Partners.

content.title: BHP to Sell Stake in Western Australia Power Infrastructure to BlackRock in $2 Billion Deal
content.summary: BHP Group will sell a 49% stake in its Western Australia iron-ore power network to BlackRock’s Global Infrastructure Partners.

headline: BHP Secures $2 Billion GIP Deal for WAIO Power Network
summary: BHP signs a major infrastructure funding agreement with GIP for its Western Australia iron ore operations.

content.title: BHP Secures $2 Billion GIP Deal for WAIO Power Network
content.summary: BHP signs a major infrastructure funding agreement with GIP for its Western Australia iron ore operations.

headline: BHP Sells Pilbara Power Stake to BlackRock Unit for $2 Billion
summary: GIP will take 49% of BHP’s shareholding in Western Australia Iron Ore’s inland power network and the miner will pay a tariff linked to its stake over a 25-year period, BHP said in a statement on Tuesday.  The deal comes as the mining giant looks to free up cash to seek growth outside its core iron ore business, particularly in copper.

content.title: BHP Sells Pilbara Power Stake to BlackRock Unit for $2 Billion
content.summary: GIP will take 49% of BHP’s shareholding in Western Australia Iron Ore’s inland power network and the miner will pay a tariff linked to its stake over a 25-year period, BHP said in a statement on Tuesday.  The deal comes as the mining giant looks to free up cash to seek growth outside its core iron ore business, particularly in copper.

headline: BHP Spurs Infrastructure Selloff as Miners Adjust Spending Plans
summary: The mining giant will sell almost half of its 85% interest in the power network to BlackRock Inc.’s Global Infrastructure Partners LP and pay a tariff linked to its stake over a 25-year period, BHP said in a statement Tuesday.  BHP first flagged its intention to sell interests in infrastructure in August, saying it would recycle capital into higher-return growth opportunities, a sentiment echoed last week by its biggest rival, Rio Tinto Group.

content.title: BHP Spurs Infrastructure Selloff as Miners Adjust Spending Plans
content.summary: The mining giant will sell almost half of its 85% interest in the power network to BlackRock Inc.’s Global Infrastructure Partners LP and pay a tariff linked to its stake over a 25-year period, BHP said in a statement Tuesday.  BHP first flagged its intention to sell interests in infrastructure in August, saying it would recycle capital into higher-return growth opportunities, a sentiment echoed last week by its biggest rival, Rio Tinto Group.

headline: US Spot BTC ETFs Bleed $60.4M as Altcoin Capital Flows Increase

headline: Trump Says Rate Cut Will Be Litmus Test For New Fed Chair
summary: Trump responded “yes” when asked in an interview with Politico if a quick reduction of borrowing costs would be a litmus test for his handpicked central bank leader.  “I think he’s a combination of not a smart person and doesn’t like Trump.”

content.title: Trump Says Rate Cut Will Be Litmus Test For New Fed Chair
content.summary: Trump responded “yes” when asked in an interview with Politico if a quick reduction of borrowing costs would be a litmus test for his handpicked central bank leader.  “I think he’s a combination of not a smart person and doesn’t like Trump.”

headline: Fed leaning toward hawkish rate cut. What's to come in 2026?
summary: The Federal Reserve's December FOMC meeting will conclude on Wednesday, December 10, with US central bank officials voting on their last interest rate decision in 2025. Yahoo Finance senior Fed reporter Jennifer Schonberger and Siebert Financial CIO Mark Malek discuss how investors are expecting a hawkish rate cut by Fed officials at this meeting, Fed Chair Jerome Powell's comments on the labor market, and Fed staffing concerns. Also check out Jennifer Schonberger's profiles on the five shortlist candidates that President Trump could nominate as the next Fed chair after Powell's term ends in May 2026: frontrunner Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, current Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Fed leaning toward hawkish rate cut. What's to come in 2026?
content.description:
The Federal Reserve's December FOMC meeting will conclude on Wednesday, December 10, with US central bank officials voting on their last interest rate decision in 2025.

Yahoo Finance senior Fed reporter Jennifer Schonberger and Siebert Financial CIO Mark Malek discuss how investors are expecting a hawkish rate cut by Fed officials at this meeting, Fed Chair Jerome Powell's comments on the labor market, and Fed staffing concerns.

Also check out Jennifer Schonberger's profiles on the five shortlist candidates that President Trump could nominate as the next Fed chair after Powell's term ends in May 2026: frontrunner Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, current Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: The Federal Reserve's December FOMC meeting will conclude on Wednesday, December 10, with US central bank officials voting on their last interest rate decision in 2025. Yahoo Finance senior Fed reporter Jennifer Schonberger and Siebert Financial CIO Mark Malek discuss how investors are expecting a hawkish rate cut by Fed officials at this meeting, Fed Chair Jerome Powell's comments on the labor market, and Fed staffing concerns. Also check out Jennifer Schonberger's profiles on the five shortlist candidates that President Trump could nominate as the next Fed chair after Powell's term ends in May 2026: frontrunner Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, current Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
